channel.title: Trust on dayowrites
channel.description: Recent content in Trust on dayowrites

item.title: Unsung Hero
item.description:
series: guest speaker #

verse: 1 Samuel 14:1-15 #

In the verse, we find a character named Jonathan who was courageous because of his unwaivering faith in God. But there is another character, the nameless armor bearer. He was a key factor in Jonathan’s success.

Main idea: #

The unsung hero is someone who receives little attention but has contributed much to the success of a team. Park Jisung is a good example of a player on Manchester United that humbly assists others. Everyone has a desire to be recognized for their good work.

item.title: The Life Giving Effect of God's Welcome
item.description:
series: An inviting God #

verse: Genesis 2:16-17 #

Main Idea: #

Human souls were not made to bear outcomes. We are not in control of the way things turn out. But God does.

The Garden of Eden was a place of abundance. But contrary to popular belief, this story isn’t about restriction and limitation and rules. God asks us to care for and maintain this beautiful orchard. And likewise, weare also tasked to take part of our own responsibilities, and also enjoy the fruit. God invites us to eat until we cant anymore. This center tree is also good but we are just not ready. What this story really tells us is that, though we may be able to decide on our own, we must first look towards what God desires from us. We shouldn’t lead and take responsibility for our selves, because it is then that we become mistaken and hurt.
